citation: Department of Health Care Access and Information Patient Discharge Data, 2016-2022; California Hospital Performance Ratings for Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) Surgery Data; Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) Inpatient Quality Indicators; The California Elective Percutaneous Coronary Intervention Program Report.
description: The dataset provides performance ratings for coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery, inpatient mortality indicators (IMIs), and elective percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). The outcome measures include: operative mortality for isolated CABG; inpatient mortality for acute stroke, acute myocardial infarction, heart failure, gastrointestinal hemorrhage, hip fracture, pneumonia, abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, carotid endarterectomy, esophageal resection, pancreatic resection, percutaneous coronary intervention; three outcome measures for elective PCI without on-site cardiac surgery: mortality, post-PCI stroke, and post-PCI emergency coronary artery bypass graft surgery; postoperative sepsis following elective surgeries. It includes risk-adjusted rates, number of adverse events and cases.
keywords: agency for healthcare research and quality
name: california-hospital-performance-ratings
related_resources: The Society of Thoracic Surgeons: http://www.sts.ogr/. http://www.qualityindicators.ahrq.gov/. ACC-NCDR CathPCI Registry. This information is provided as a courtesy. The State does not control any third party web services or any of the material on their sites. It does not imply approval or endorsement of the organization represented by the website or the website content. See CalHHS Terms of Use for additional information.

resources.description: The dataset provides performance ratings for coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery, inpatient mortality indicators (IMIs), elective percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), and Postoperative sepsis (PSI). The outcome measures include: operative mortality for isolated CABG;  inpatient mortality for acute stroke, acute myocardial infarction, heart failure, gastrointestinal hemorrhage, hip fracture, pneumonia,  abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, carotid endarterectomy, esophageal resection, pancreatic resection, percutaneous coronary intervention;  three outcome measures for elective percutaneous coronary intervention without on-site cardiac surgery: mortality, post-PCI stroke, post-PCI emergency coronary artery bypass graft surgery, and postoperative sepsis.  It includes risk-adjusted rates, number of adverse events and cases.
